newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end softer despite Dow rebound.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end softer despite Dow rebound.

text.p: CHANGE CHANGE
NIKKEI 20413.46 -8.58 LME CASH NICKEL US$6445 -77.0
CANDLR 1.3630 LME CASH ALUM US$1488.0 +11.0
CAN 30-YR 108.60 -0.25 BRENT FEB CRUDE US$23.70 -0.19
* Toronto stocks ended softer on Tuesday, despite a 40-point rebound in New York * Weak media, retail, base metal stocks offset gains in banking, energy * 96 million shares traded
Toronto's key 300 index posted a modest loss on Tuesday as Canada's biggest stock market ignored a strong rebound in New York.
The TSE 300 Composite Index eased 2.17 points to close at 5710.20 in heavy turnover of 96.7 million shares worth C$1.5 billion.
Declining stocks outnumbered advances 551 to 413 with 302 issues flat. The Dow Jones Industrial Average added nearly 40 points as U.S. stocks recovered from Monday's selloff.
A 176-point decline in the TSE's communications and media group offset gains in banking, energy and transportation.

Rate-sensitive issues received a boost from the U.S. Federal Reserve's widely-expected decision to keep interest rates steady. "Your getting a bounce in New York and in Canada we're beginning to get a bit of recovery in the financials," said Bill Ram, a Montreal-based stock strategist.
Toronto's oil and gas sector extended its recent rally with an 83-point gain on Tuesday, despite weaker oil prices.
Petro-Canada topped the TSE's most-active list, climbing 0.10 to 19.40 on 3.4 million shares. The energy giant is expected to name a strategic partner for its Terra Nova project shortly.
Among other hot stocks:
* Lynx Energy class A led net gainers, jumping 5 to 20 in very light volume. Talisman Energy improved 1.15 to 44.60 on 665,000 shares.
Imperial Oil ignored the energy rally, closing down 0.95 to 59.10 on 90,000 shares.
* In financial services, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce rose 1.10 to 55.55, while Bank of Nova Scotia added 0.55 to 42.35.
* The media group was led downward by Thomson Corp, off 0.90 at 26.75. Torstar Corp class B fell 0.55 to 32.45.
((Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8100))
